#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=FIFA World Cup 2018 Last 16 : Russia , Croatia beat
#Text=Spain , Denmark in penalties
#Text=Wednesday , July 4 , 2018
#Text=On Sunday , Spain lost to Russia 4 – 3 in the penalty shootout while Croatia defeated Denmark 3 – 2 in the penalty shootout in the FIFA football World Cup in the Last 16 knockout phase .
#Text=Both the matches were 1 – 1 at the end of added time .
#Text=Spain v Russia
#Text=Spain took on hosts Russia at the Luzhniki Stadium in Moscow .
#Text=Spain had greater ball possession .
#Text=Spain got an early lead shortly after the 10th minute when Sergei Ignashevich scored an own goal .
#Text=In the 40th minute , Spanish defender Gerard Piqué was yellow-carded for a handball in the penalty area and Russia was awarded a penalty kick .
#Text=Artem Dzyuba scored from the spot kick , sending Spanish goalkeeper David de Gea in the other direction , equalising for Russia before the halftime .
#Text=Isco and Diego Costa attempted goal before the half-time whistle , but the attempts were blocked or stopped .
#Text=The first half ended with 1 – 1 on the scoreboard .
#Text=Early in the second half , Jordi Alba had an attempt from Marco Asensio 's assist but was saved .
#Text=Sergio Busquets , David Silva , Iago Aspas and Andrés Iniesta had attempts to put Spain back in the lead , but were unsuccessful .
#Text=The second half ended without and goals and the match went to extra time .
#Text=The extra time saw Dani Carvajal and Rodrigo Moreno also making attempts for goals but the match went on to penalties to separate the two sides .
#Text=For Spain , Iniesta , Piqué , and captain Sergio Ramos scored the goals while Koke and Aspas failed to score from their kicks .
#Text=Fyodor Smolov , Sergei Ignashevich , and Aleksandr Sergeyevich Golovin scored their penalty kicks .
#Text=Denis Cheryshev scored the winning goal for Russia .
#Text=Spanish midfielder Iniesta retired from international football after the match .
#Text=Croatia v Denmark
#Text=Croatia faced Denmark at the Nizhny Novgorod Stadium and had greater ball possession .
#Text=The Danish side opened the scoring in the first minute when Mathias Jørgensen scored a close-range shot from Thomas Delaney 's assist .
#Text=But Denmark 's lead did not last long as Mario Mandžukić equalised for Croatia in the 4th minute .
#Text=Both the sides had multiple attempts and misses for the goal .
#Text=The first half ended with 1 – 1 on the scoreboard .
#Text=The second half remained goalless and the match went to additional extra time .
#Text=In the 116th minute , Croatia had a penalty kick as Ante Rebić was brought down in the penalty area .
#Text=Luka Modrić took the penalty kick but was saved by the Danish goalkeeper .
#Text=The extra time ended 1 – 1 .
#Text=In the penalty shootout , Denmark 's Christian Eriksen and Croatia 's Milan Badelj 's kicks were saved .
#Text=Simon Kjær and Michael Krohn-Dehli scored their kicks for Denmark while Andrej Kramarić and Luka Modrić scored their kicks for Croatia .
#Text=Both the sides were 2 – 2 .
#Text=Denmark 's Lasse Schöne and Croatia 's Josip Pivarić 's kicks were saved .
#Text=Jørgensen 's kick was saved by the Croatian goalkeeper and Ivan Rakitić scored the winning penalty kick for Croatia as they advanced to the quarterfinals .

#Text=July 1 , 2018 1700 MSK ( UTC+0300 ) Spain 1 – 1 ( a. e. t. ) Russia Luzhniki Stadium , Moscow , Russia Attendance : 78,011 Referee : Björn Kuipers ( Netherlands ) Sergei Ignashevich 11 – 12'(o . g. ) Gerard Piqué 40 '

#Text=Andrés Iniesta Gerard Piqué Koke Sergio Ramos Iago Aspas ( 3 – 4 ) ( penalties ) Artyom Dzyuba 41'(pen . ) Ilya Kutepov 54 ' Roman Zobnin 71 ' Fedor Smolov Sergei Ignashevich Aleksandr Golovin Denis Cheryshev July 1 , 2018 2100 MSK ( UTC+0300 ) Croatia 1 – 1 ( a. e. t. ) Denmark Nizhny Novgorod Stadium , Nizhny Novgorod , Russia Attendance : 40,851 Referee : Néstor Pitana ( Argentina ) Mario Mandžukić 4 ' Milan Badelj Andrej Kramarić Luka Modrić Josip Pivarić Ivan Rakitić ( 3 – 2 ) ( penalties ) Mathias Jørgensen 1'Mathias Jørgensen 115 ' Christian Eriksen Simon Kjær Michael Krohn-Dehli Lasse Schöne Nicolai Jørgensen
